block.p: The shops at Chelsea Market, 75 Ninth Avenue (15th Street), will hold a tasting of their goods tomorrow, from 7 to 10 p.m., to benefit the Multiple Sclerosis Society. Tickets are $75, $90 at the door: (212) 463-7787, ext. 3016.

The shops at Chelsea Market, 75 Ninth Avenue (15th Street), will hold a tasting of their goods tomorrow, from 7 to 10 p.m., to benefit the Multiple Sclerosis Society. Tickets are $75, $90 at the door: (212) 463-7787, ext. 3016.

Several food booths will be part of the 21st annual Asian-Pacific Heritage Festival, in Union Square on Sunday from noon to 6 p.m. The Asian Culinary Society, a nonprofit educational group, will concentrate on Southeast Asia, offering Thai iced coffee, a nonalcoholic passion fruit spritzer and a Thai curry. Admission is free.

A mushroom workshop, with tips on foraging and cooking, will be given by Gary Lincoff, author of the ''Audubon Society Field Guide to North American Mushrooms,'' on Monday from 10 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. at the New York Botanical Garden in the Bronx. Participants should bring lunch. The workshop is $40 for members, $44 for nonmembers: (718) 817-8747.

A B.Y.O. lunchtime workshop on making herb-infused oils and vinegars will be held on Tuesday from 12:30 to 1:30 p.m. at the Horticultural Society of New York, 128 West 58th Street. The fee is $50.40 for members, $56 for nonmembers: (212) 757-0915, ext. 200.

A tasting of New Zealand wines will be held on May 10 from 6:30 to 9 p.m. at the Empire Hotel, 44 West 63rd Street. The event benefits the Historic House Trust of New York City. For tickets, $35: (212) 360-1378.

The choreographer Geoffrey Holder will star on May 15 in the Harmony in the Kitchen series at Peter Kump's New York Cooking School, in which performers demonstrate their favorite dishes; 6:30 to 9 p.m. The fee is $80: (212) 847-0770.
